|footnotes = |signature = }}'Carl Erich Correns' (September 10, 1864 - February
14, 1933) was a German botanist and geneticist, who is notable primarily for
his independent discovery of the principles of heredity, and for his
rediscovery of Gregor Mendel's earlier paper on that subject, which he achieved
simultaneously but independently of the botanists Erich Tschermak von Seysenegg
and Hugo de Vries.

Correns was a student of Karl NÃ¤geli, a renowned botanist with whom Mendel
corresponded about his work with peas, but who failed to understand how
significant Mendel's work was.
